VLIB_convertUYVYpl_to_YUVint

Detailed Description


Functions

int32_t VLIB_convertUYVYpl_to_YUVint (const uint8_t *restrict y, const uint8_t *restrict cr, const uint8_t *restrict cb, uint32_t width, int32_t pitch, uint32_t height, uint8_t *restrict yc)

Function Documentation

int32_t VLIB_convertUYVYpl_to_YUVint ( const uint8_t *restrict  y,
const uint8_t *restrict  cr,
const uint8_t *restrict  cb,
uint32_t  width,
int32_t  pitch,
uint32_t  height,
uint8_t *restrict  yc 
)

Introduction and Use Cases:
YUV422 is a common imaging data format. If the information stored in the planar YUV format needs to be displayed it often needs to be interleaved first. This functions efficiently interleaves the YUV color channels.
Description:
This function interleaves the three YUV422 planar channels into a single YUV422 interleaved format.
Parameters:
[in] *y Luma plane (8-bit) (UQ8.0)
[in] *cr Cr chroma plane (8-bit) (UQ8.0)
[in] *cb Cb chroma plane (8-bit) (UQ8.0)
[in] width Width of input image (number of luma pixels) (in pixels)
[in] pitch Pitch of input image (number of luma pixels) (in pixels)
[in] height Height of input image(number of luma pixels) (in pixels)
[out] *yc Interleaved luma/chroma (UQ8.0)
Assumptions
  • All arrays should be 64-bit aligned.
  • width should be a multiple of 16, and greater than 0
  • pitch should be a multiple of 16, and >= width
  • the *y buffer is of pitch bytes between start of each line
  • the *cr and *cb buffers is of pitch/2 bytes between start of each line
  • *yc buffer stores each line of width with no gap in between (pitch only applies to input buffers).
Implementation Notes:
  • Internally, there are 2 modes:
    • Mode 1: Most efficient mode is when pitch == width
    • Mode 2: Kernel supports when pitch > width, but less performance
Benchmarks:
See VLIB_Test_Report.html for cycle and memory information.
References:
  1. Digital Image Processing by R.C.Gonzales and R.E.Woods, Prentice-Hall, 2007
